failure_categories.description: Model very confident but wrong - likely subtle artifacts, device shadows, or anatomical variations mistaken for pathology
failure_categories.recommendation: Review with Grad-CAM to identify spurious features. Consider data augmentation to reduce reliance on artifacts.

failure_categories.description: Model uncertain predictions - borderline cases with ambiguous features
failure_categories.recommendation: Threshold adjustment can eliminate these. Acceptable trade-off for higher recall.

failure_categories.description: Model confident NORMAL but missed pneumonia - critical errors indicating early/subtle signs or poor image quality
failure_categories.recommendation: ⚠️ PRIORITY: Manually review these cases. May need additional training data with subtle pneumonia cases.

failure_categories.description: Model uncertain about pneumonia - lowering threshold can catch these cases
failure_categories.recommendation: Threshold tuning recommended. Consider ensemble or secondary review for low-confidence predictions.

medical_implications.FP_clinical_impact: False positives lead to unnecessary follow-up tests (X-ray confirmation, CT, labs). Increases healthcare costs but low patient harm.
medical_implications.FN_clinical_impact: ⚠️ CRITICAL: False negatives mean missed pneumonia cases. Can delay treatment and worsen patient outcomes. Must be minimized.
medical_implications.threshold_strategy: For medical screening: Lower threshold to maximize recall (sensitivity ≥99%), accept higher false positive rate. Use as triage tool, not diagnostic.

next_steps: 1. Generate Grad-CAM visualizations for top high-confidence errors
2. Perform threshold sweep to find optimal operating point (Max Recall mode)
3. Consider ensemble methods or secondary classifier for borderline cases
4. Collect additional training data for failure modes (if available)
5. Document error patterns in Model Card for transparency
